Description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error.
Name: Bad Request

Description: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not been provided.
Name: Unauthorized

Description: Reserved for future use.
Name: Payment Required

Description: The request was valid, but the server is refusing action. The user might not have the necessary permissions for a resource.
Name: Forbidden

Description: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future.
Name: Not Found

Description: A request method is not supported for the requested resource.
Name: Method Not Allowed

Description: The requested resource is capable of generating only content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request.
Name: Not Acceptable

Description: The client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.
Name: Proxy Authentication Required

Description: The server timed out waiting for the request. According to HTTP specifications: "The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time."
Name: Request Timeout

Description: Indicates that the request could not be processed because of conflict in the request, such as an edit conflict between multiple simultaneous updates.
Name: Conflict

Description: Indicates that the resource requested is no longer available and will not be available again.
Name: Gone

Description: The request did not specify the length of its content, which is required by the requested resource.
Name: Length Required

Description: The server does not meet one of the preconditions that the requester put on the request.
Name: Precondition Failed

Description: The request is larger than the server is willing or able to process.
Name: Payload Too Large

Description: The URI provided was too long for the server to process.
Name: URI Too Long

Description: The request entity has a media type which the server or resource does not support.
Name: Unsupported Media Type

Description: The client has asked for a portion of the file (byte serving), but the server cannot supply that portion.
Name: Range Not Satisfiable

Description: The server cannot meet the requirements of the Expect request-header field.
Name: Expectation Failed

Description: The request was directed at a server that is not able to produce a response.
Name: Misdirected Request

Description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.
Name: Unprocessable Entity

Description: The resource that is being accessed is locked.
Name: Locked

Description: The request failed due to failure of a previous request.
Name: Failed Dependency

Description: Indicates that the server is unwilling to risk processing a request that might be replayed.
Name: Too Early

Description: The client should switch to a different protocol such as TLS/1.0, given in the Upgrade header field.
Name: Upgrade Required

Description: The origin server requires the request to be conditional.
Name: Precondition Required

Description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.
Name: Too Many Requests

Description: The server is unwilling to process the request because either an individual header field, or all the header fields collectively, are too large.
Name: Request Header Fields Too Large

Description: The server returns no information to the client and closes the connection.
Name: No Response

Description: The server cannot honour the request because the user has not provided the required information.
Name: Retry With

Description: A Windows Parental Controls-controlled user attempted to access a forbidden website. The site should not be displayed.
Name: Blocked by Windows Parental Controls

Description: The server is denying access to the resource as a consequence of a legal demand
Name: Unavailable For Legal Reasons

Description: A generic error message, given when no more specific message is suitable
Name: Internal Server Error

Description: The server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfil the request
Name: Not Implemented

Description: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server
Name: Bad Gateway

Description: The server is currently unavailable (because it is overloaded or down for maintenance)
Name: Service Unavailable

Description: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response from the upstream server
Name: Gateway Timeout

Description: The server does not support the HTTP protocol version used in the request
Name: HTTP Version Not Supported

Description: Transparent content negotiation for the request results in a circular reference
Name: Variant Also Negotiates

Description: The server is unable to store the representation needed to complete the request
Name: Insufficient Storage

Description: The server detected an infinite loop while processing the request
Name: Loop Detected

Description: The server has exceeded the bandwidth specified by the server administrator
Name: Bandwidth Limit Exceeded

Description: Further extensions to the request are required for the server to fulfil it
Name: Not Extended

Description: The client needs to authenticate to gain network access
Name: Network Authentication Required

Description: The server refuses to fulfill the request.
Name: Permission Denied

Description: The client needs to change the request, such as adding a new request header.
Name: Option Not Supported

Description: The server did not receive a complete request message within the time that it was prepared to wait.
Name: Network Read Timeout Error

Description: The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client may repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
Name: Network Connect Timeout Error

Description: The server has received the request headers, and the client should proceed to send the request body
Name: Continue

Description: The requester has asked the server to switch protocols
Name: Switching Protocols

Description: The server is processing the request, but no response is available yet
Name: Processing

Description: The server is sending the client some information about the response before the full response is ready
Name: Early Hints

Description: There are multiple options available for the resource that the client may follow
Name: Multiple Choices

Description: The requested resource has been permanently moved to a new location
Name: Moved Permanently

Description: The requested resource has been temporarily moved to a new location
Name: Found

Description: The response to the request can be found under a different URI
Name: See Other

Description: The requested resource has not been modified since the last time it was accessed
Name: Not Modified

Description: The requested resource must be accessed through the proxy given by the Location field
Name: Use Proxy

Description: This status code is no longer used and is reserved for future use
Name: Switch Proxy

Description: The requested resource has been temporarily moved to a new location
Name: Temporary Redirect

Description: The requested resource has been permanently moved to a new location
Name: Permanent Redirect

Description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.
Name: OK

Description: The request has been fulfilled, resulting in the creation of a new resource.
Name: Created

Description: The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.
Name: Accepted

Description: The server is a transforming proxy (e.g. a Web accelerator) that received a 200 OK from its origin, but is returning a modified version of the originâ€™s response.
Name: Non-Authoritative Information

Description: The server successfully processed the request and is not returning any content.
Name: No Content

Description: The server successfully processed the request and is not returning any content. Unlike a 204 response, this response requires that the requester reset the document view.
Name: Reset Content

Description: The server is delivering only part of the resource due to a range header sent by the client.
Name: Partial Content

Description: The message body that follows is by default an XML message and can contain a number of separate response codes, depending on how many sub-requests were made.
Name: Multi-Status

Description: The members of a DAV binding have already been enumerated in a previous reply to this request, and are not being included again.
Name: Already Reported

Description: The server has fulfilled a request for the resource, and the response is a representation of the result of one or more instance-manipulations applied to the current instance.
Name: IM Used

Description: The Uppies Check experienced a problem.
Name: Uppies Check Error

Description: The Uppies experienced an encoding error.
Name: Uppies Encoding Error
